page.title: 16Landscape and Buildings
page.content: The land in the block is fairly flat varying between 90 and 100 metres above sea level. The River Cole flows west to east across the northern section to join the River Blythe. The Chelmsley Wood housing estate is between 15 and 20 years old and was purpose built on Green Belt land. In the centre of the estate is the town centre a two storey brick and concrete shopping precinct. Near the centre there is a police station, telephone exchange and library all concrete structures. The area is dominated by the multi storey blocks of flats. There are about 25 of these concrete buildings from about 10 to 13 storeys high. The low rise housing is mainly red brick built and there are large areas of grass and open space in between.
